sentence: Right now, the real threats to rural America and to water security  and the livelihoods of America's farmers are trade wars that are  hammering agricultural exports.

sentence: Speaker, let's stop the chaos of trade wars, arbitrary pauses,  crazy tariffs, and threats.
title: Trump Tariffs

sentence: He  said, in 1987, though there are economic and national security  circumstances during which tariffs are necessary, that, generally,  ``high tariffs inevitably lead to retaliation by foreign countries and  the triggering of fierce trade wars.
title: Terminating the National Emergency Declared to Impose Duties on Articles Imported From Canada

sentence: As inflation continues to grow and threats of  trade wars persist, the cost of necessities like groceries, childcare,  and housing will continue to increase putting a greater burden on  American families.
title: Republican Budget Betrayal

sentence: Speaker, today I rise on behalf of all of the  families who are being hurt by this administration's reckless trade  wars.
title: Protecting American Families

sentence: I am committed to speaking up for American families and small  businesses that have been shouldering the burden of higher costs  because of President Trump's trade wars.
It is because they are more afraid of his retribution than they  are concerned about the budgets of their families back home, families  who are paying for Trump's endless trade wars.

sentence: And by inciting these trade wars, Trump is  cutting off essential export markets for our farmers.

sentence: Yet, I guess all good policy is, once again,  falling to the feet of the divisive political rhetoric around  immigrants and crime that my colleagues across the aisle have embraced  as their salvo to save them from the bleak economic picture that our  country faces today: higher joblessness; Trumpflation; a host of  reckless policies, including trade wars, that have cost the American  people.
title: Stop Illegal Entry Act of 2025

sentence: We are still in the middle of one of the worst trade wars we have  ever seen in human history based on--what is it?--140 percent now with  China.
title: Trump's First 100 Days

sentence: High tariffs inevitably lead to       retaliation by foreign countries and the triggering of fierce       trade wars.
title: Terminating the National Emergency Declared to Impose Duties on Articles Imported From Canada

sentence: American families, small businesses,  and farmers are paying the price for these endless trade wars.
title: Relating to A National Emergency By the President on February 2025

sentence:
We declared independence, in the words of Jefferson, because we  didn't wish to be ruled by a King who ``cut off our trade'' and imposed  ``taxes on us without our consent.''

But today we have a President unilaterally declaring costly trade  wars on our allies and imposing hefty taxes on his citizens, a  President who withholds the people's tax money already appropriated by  Congress based on his latest whim.

Did you speak up at a time when the President of the United States  was launching trade wars against our closest allies, when he was firing  regulators who investigate America's biggest banks and biggest  corporations to stop them from taking advantage of the little guy or  the little gal or my grandmother or your grandfather, dismantling the  Agency that protects consumers from fraud--the only one whose sole  purpose is to look out for them?
title: Privileges of the Floor

sentence: However, we must not allow President Trump to put this great progress  in jeopardy with his chaotic trade wars and uncertain tariff policies.
title: Critical Infrastructure Manufacturing Feasibility Act
